articles.headline: What Will Happen to Social Security After Trump Takes Office?
articles.snippet: Readers are concerned that his campaign proposals would put Social Security’s finances on thinner ice, endangering their payments.
articles.abstract: Readers are concerned that his campaign proposals would put Social Security’s finances on thinner ice, endangering their payments.
articles.lead_paragraph: Americans are polarized on many issues, but there’s at least one program that continually wins nearly everyone’s support: Social Security.

articles.headline: Gaetz Pick Unnerves an Already Jittery Justice Dept. and F.B.I.
articles.snippet: Senior law enforcement officials face a wave of uncertainty as Donald J. Trump moves to nominate a fierce partisan and a longtime ally to fill one of the most powerful cabinet posts.
articles.abstract: Senior law enforcement officials face a wave of uncertainty as Donald J. Trump moves to nominate a fierce partisan and a longtime ally to fill one of the most powerful cabinet posts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Matt Gaetz, who savaged the Justice Department and the F.B.I. as Donald J. Trump’s off-leash political guard dog, faces an uphill fight to becoming attorney general. But his selection has already achieved one desired effect: intimidating an already-frazzled federal law enforcement work force.
articles.byline: By Glenn Thrush and Adam Goldman

articles.headline: Fed Chair Powell Says There’s No Need to ‘Hurry’ to Cut Rates
articles.snippet: A strong economy is giving Federal Reserve officials room to move “carefully” as they lower interest rates, the central bank chair said.
articles.abstract: A strong economy is giving Federal Reserve officials room to move “carefully” as they lower interest rates, the central bank chair said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, said that a solid economy with low unemployment, robust consumer spending and strengthening business investment gave the central bank room to take its time in cutting interest rates.

articles.headline: At France-Israel Game, Soccer Takes a Back Seat to Politics and Security
articles.snippet: After the recent violence around an Israeli team’s game in Amsterdam, French leaders insisted on proceeding under security with a France-Israel match, and on showing up, themselves.
articles.abstract: After the recent violence around an Israeli team’s game in Amsterdam, French leaders insisted on proceeding under security with a France-Israel match, and on showing up, themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was the type of political attention reserved for only the biggest of sporting occasions.
articles.byline: By Tariq Panja and Catherine Porter

articles.headline: Trump Picks R.F.K. Jr. to Be Head of Health and Human Services Dept.
articles.snippet: Whether the Senate would confirm Robert F. Kennedy Jr., a vaccine skeptic who has unorthodox views about medicine, is an open question.
articles.abstract: Whether the Senate would confirm Robert F. Kennedy Jr., a vaccine skeptic who has unorthodox views about medicine, is an open question.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Thursday that he would nominate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to lead the Department of Health and Human Services, setting up a debate over whether Mr. Kennedy, whose vaccine skepticism and unorthodox views about medicine make public health officials deeply uneasy, can be confirmed.

articles.headline: Tech Elite Push Tech Elite to Elon Musk for Cabinet Positions
articles.snippet: Tech leaders are recommending their own brethren to Mr. Musk and others, as they aim to leave a Silicon Valley imprint on Donald Trump’s new administration.
articles.abstract: Tech leaders are recommending their own brethren to Mr. Musk and others, as they aim to leave a Silicon Valley imprint on Donald Trump’s new administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: A former top Uber executive to head the Department of Transportation. A former top aide to Peter Thiel to head the Department of Health and Human Services. And a cadre of other tech executives to join Elon Musk at the Department of Government Efficiency.
articles.byline: By Theodore Schleifer and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Trump Takes On the Pillars of the ‘Deep State’
articles.snippet: The Justice Department, Pentagon and intelligence agencies were the three areas of government that proved to be the most stubborn obstacles to Mr. Trump in his first term.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department, Pentagon and intelligence agencies were the three areas of government that proved to be the most stubborn obstacles to Mr. Trump in his first term.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump is wasting little time in taking on the three governmental institutions that most frustrated his political ambitions during his first term and making clear he will not brook resistance in his second.

articles.headline: World Fears a Wider Trade War. Malaysia Sees an Opportunity.
articles.snippet: With Donald J. Trump promising tariffs, Malaysia hopes a deal with Singapore for greater economic integration will strengthen its role as a China alternative.
articles.abstract: With Donald J. Trump promising tariffs, Malaysia hopes a deal with Singapore for greater economic integration will strengthen its role as a China alternative.
articles.lead_paragraph: During his first term as president, when Donald J. Trump started a tariff war to pit the United States against China, Malaysia bet on both sides. The Southeast Asian nation aggressively courted American and Chinese companies with tax breaks and other goodies.

articles.headline: Trump Immigration Targets: Ukrainians, Venezuelans, Haitians
articles.snippet: The president-elect has vowed to end a program that allows thousands of people from troubled nations to stay in the United States.
articles.abstract: The president-elect has vowed to end a program that allows thousands of people from troubled nations to stay in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump has vowed a crackdown on immigration like never before.
articles.byline: By Miriam Jordan and Hamed Aleaziz

articles.headline: Biden Cements TSMC Grant Before Trump Takes Over
articles.snippet: The White House is racing to finish grant agreements for chip manufacturers, but some of its biggest successes might be credited to the Trump administration.
articles.abstract: The White House is racing to finish grant agreements for chip manufacturers, but some of its biggest successes might be credited to the Trump administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Biden administration said on Friday that it had completed an agreement to award Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company up to $6.6 billion in grants, as federal officials race to put in place their plans to boost U.S. chip manufacturing before the end of President Biden’s term.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Madeleine Ngo

articles.headline: How a Corruption ‘Carousel’ Got Fugitives Off Interpol’s Red Notice List
articles.snippet: Suspects sought on various charges, including drug trafficking, paid officials to exploit a mechanism intended to protect asylum seekers, according to Moldovan and French investigators.
articles.abstract: Suspects sought on various charges, including drug trafficking, paid officials to exploit a mechanism intended to protect asylum seekers, according to Moldovan and French investigators.
articles.lead_paragraph: The suspect in a drug trafficking case was wanted in France in connection with three tons of cocaine seized near Marseille in 2020 but had fled abroad. He was placed on a list of fugitives flagged for arrest by Interpol, the international police organization, and later detained in Dubai, in the United Arab Emirates.
